text: Hur Suk-ho (; born 20 August 1973), who is usually known as SK Ho in English, is a South Korean professional golfer who plays mainly on the Japan Golf Tour. Hur was born in Seoul. He attended Chae Yoog University and turned pro in 1995. He joined the Japanese Tour in 2001 and has won eight tournaments on it. He has made several appearances in major championships and World Golf Championships events. ==Professional wins (9)== ===Japan Golf Tour wins (8)=== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:95%;" |- style="background:#eee;" |Legend |- style="background:thistle;" | Tour Championships (1) |- style="background:#D6E8FF;" | Japan majors (3) |- | Other Japan Golf Tour (5) |} {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:95%;" !No.!!Date!!Tournament!!Winning score!!Margin of victory!!Runner(s)-up |- |align=center|1 |align=right|14 Jul 2002 |Juken Sangyo Open Hiroshima |−14 (64-70-71-69=274) |3 strokes | Mamo Osanai |-style="background:#D6E8FF;" |align=center|2 |align=right|16 May 2004 |Japan PGA Championship |−14 (66-68-68=202) |1 stroke | Keiichiro Fukabori |-style="background:thistle;" |align=center|3 |align=right|4 Jul 2004 |Japan Golf Tour Championship Shishido Hills Cup |−5 (70-74-67-68=279) |Playoff | Tomohiro Kondo |-style="background:#D6E8FF;" |align=center|4 |align=right|15 May 2005 |Japan PGA Championship (2) |−16 (68-68-67-69=272) |2 strokes | Hideto Tanihara |- |align=center|5 |align=right|5 Jun 2005 |JCB Classic Sendai |−19 (63-67-66-69=265) |1 stroke | Shinichi Yokota |- |align=center|6 |align=right|25 Jun 2006 |Gateway to the Open Mizuno Open |−14 (68-69-66-71=274) |3 strokes | Tatsuhiko Ichihara, David Smail |- |align=center|7 |align=right|27 Apr 2008 |Tsuruya Open |−12 (70-69-65-68=272) |1 stroke | Kim Kyung-tae |- |align=center|8 |align=right|9 Nov 2008 |The Championship by Lexus |−15 (66-68-65-70=269) |5 strokes | Kiyoshi Miyazato |} * The Japan Golf Tour Championship is also a Japan major championship.
